channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Russia Says Bomb Downed Plane in Egypt and Intensifies Attacks on ISIS
item.description: The head of the Federal Security Service said “an improvised explosive device” had detonated soon after the plane took off over two weeks ago, killing 224.
item.dc:creator: NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:credit: Maxim Grigoryev/Russia's Emergency Ministry, Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: The crash site of the Russian jetliner in Egypt's Sinai Peninsula in October.

item.title: Cease-Fire and Political Transition in Syria Crucial to Defeating ISIS, Kerry Says
item.description: The secretary of state expressed optimism that a shift could come within weeks now that the United States and other nations have agreed to a framework.
item.dc:creator: JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry, right, with President François Hollande of France in Paris on Tuesday. Mr. Kerry said the Islamic State "will feel greater pressure" over the next few weeks.

item.title: Paris Attacks Suspect Was Target of Strikes on ISIS in Syria
item.description: Abdelhamid Abaaoud is believed to have escaped to Syria from Belgium after the authorities in January foiled another terrorist plot, a European security official said.
item.dc:creator: AURELIEN BREEDEN, KATRIN BENNHOLD and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA
item.media:credit: Sebastien Dupont/French Army Communications Audiovisual office
item.media:description: A French Army fighter jet at an undisclosed air base on Tuesday. The Defense Ministry said its strikes in Syria destroyed an Islamic State command center and a training center.

item.title: U.S. Navy Ship, Bearing Message of Good Will, Docks in China
item.description: The commander of the United States Pacific Fleet met a Chinese vice admiral on board the destroyer as it began a weeklong port visit in Shanghai.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: JANE PERLEZ
item.media:description: The Stethem, an American guided missile destroyer, arrived on Monday at the Wusong military port in northern Shanghai.

item.title: China in Mind, Obama Pledges Military Aid to Allies in Southeast Asia
item.description: The aid, $250 million over the next two years, is an effort to stand up to China’s increasingly aggressive claims on the South China Sea.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL D. SHEAR

item.title: Aung San Suu Kyi, Long a Symbol of Dignified Defiance, Sounds a Provocative Note
item.description: The leader of the National League for Democracy party in Myanmar has put reconciliation with the generals high on her agenda, but her words have become more audacious.
item.dc:creator: SETH MYDANS
item.media:credit: Ye Aung Thu/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the pro-democracy opposition leader in Myanmar, arriving at Parliament in the capital, Naypyidaw, after general elections this month.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: China Responds to Paris Attacks Through a Domestic Lens
item.description: Along with revulsion, Chinese leaders and many citizens also voiced a more complex mix of expectations and emotions, rooted in rival views of the country’s own problems.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:description: The Oriental Pearl Tower in Shanghai was bathed in blue, white and red, the colors of the French flag, after the attacks in Paris.

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: France’s War Within
item.description: An embattled republic fights abroad, but also faces threats at home.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: SYLVIE KAUFFMANN

item.title: Waiter Killed in Paris Attacks Is Remembered as a Bon Vivant
item.description: Guillaume Le Dramp had taken the night off from his job to attend a birthday party at La Belle Équipe bistro, where he died along with 18 others on Friday.
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY
item.media:description: Guillaume Le Dramp in a photograph provided by his family.

item.title: France Launches New Airstrikes on ISIS in Syria
item.description: The Defense Ministry said that 10 warplanes had bombed a militant command center and a training facility, destroying them both.
item.dc:creator: AURELIEN BREEDEN and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA

item.title: With Modigliani Purchase, Chinese Billionaire Dreams of Bigger Canvas
item.description: The couple who bought the Modigliani at a Christie’s auction last week said they hoped to transform their museum in Shanghai into a world-class destination.
item.dc:creator: AMY QIN
item.media:credit: Sim Chi Yin for The New York Times
item.media:description: The art collector Liu Yiqian, who paid $170.4 million with fees for a Modigliani painting.

item.title: Late-Night Hosts Respond to the Paris Attacks on a Serious Note
item.description: One by one, the comedians condemned the violence and its perpetrators on Monday while expressing solidarity with Paris and grief for the victims.
item.dc:creator: DAVE ITZKOFF
item.media:description: Stephen Colbert, the host of “The Late Show” on CBS.

item.title: World Briefing: Syria: Iran Reaffirms a Role for Assad
item.description: A deputy foreign minister said that President Bashar al-Assad should remain in power and be included in elections as part of any diplomatic negotiation aimed at ending the civil war.
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: World Briefing: Guinea: Last Known Ebola Patient Has Recovered and Is Released
item.description: The release of the patient, a baby, meant that Guinea could begin a 42-day countdown to formally end the outbreak.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Italy: Reporter Rebuffs Summons by Vatican for Questioning on Leaks
item.description: The journalist, Gianluigi Nuzzi, who wrote a book detailing financial mismanagement in the Vatican, was called to be interrogated in a case against a monsignor accused of leaking documents.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Germany: Former Spy Acknowledges Giving Classified Information to C.I.A.
item.description: The former spy, a 32-year-old man identified only as Markus R. because of privacy laws, confessed at the opening of his trial in Munich’s state court.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Paris Attacks Complicate Europe’s Already Strained Border Controls
item.description: The news that one attacker entered Europe with a Syrian passport has reinvigorated calls for tighter borders.
item.dc:creator: ALISON SMALE and BARBARA SURK

item.title: Where ISIS Claims It Has Struck, and Why
item.description: In recent weeks, the group appears to have struck on three continents, killing hundreds of people.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: RUSSELL GOLDMAN and KAREN YOURISH
item.media:description: Suicide bombers killed 43 people in a busy district of Beirut, Lebanon, on Nov. 12. The Islamic State claimed responsibility.

item.title: Riva Palacio Journal: Mennonite Farmers Prepare to Leave Mexico, and Competition for Water
item.description: In Chihuahua State, relations between Mennonites and other farmers have been strained by a water supply that officials have said could run out in 20 years.
item.dc:creator: VICTORIA BURNETT
item.media:credit: Daniel Berehulak for The New York Times
item.media:description: Sara and Gertruda Friesen made a dress at their family home in Santa Rita, in Chihuahua State, Mexico.

item.title: In Suspects’ Brussels Neighborhood, a History of Petty Crimes and Missed Chances
item.description: Molenbeek, a known haven for extremists, was home to Ibrahim Abdeslam, who blew himself up in Paris. Although the authorities there had him in their sights, he slipped through their fingers.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ANDREW HIGGINS, KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA and KATRIN BENNHOLD
item.media:description: Belgian special forces scaled an apartment house in the Molenbeek district of Brussels on Monday, searching for suspects in the deadly attacks in Paris.
